member.summary: Provides a CSDL-specific annotations manager.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Library.Annotations.EdmDirectValueAnnotationsManager
member.summary: Direct-value annotations manager provides services for setting and getting transient annotations on elements.
member.remarks: An object representing transient annotations is in one of these states: 1) Null, if the element has no transient annotations. 2) An EdmAnnotation, if the element has exactly one annotation. 3) A list of EdmAnnotation, if the element has more than one annotation. If the speed of annotation lookup for elements with many annotations becomes a concern, another option including a dictionary is possible.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Annotations.IEdmDirectValueAnnotationsManager
member.summary: Manages getting and setting direct value annotations on EDM elements.

member.returns: The direct value annotations for the element.

member.summary: Sets an annotation value for an EDM element. If the value is null, no annotation is added and an existing annotation with the same name is removed.
member.param: The annotated element.
Namespace that the annotation belongs to.
Name of the annotation within the namespace.
The value of the annotation.

member.summary: Sets a set of annotation values. If a supplied value is null, no annotation is added and an existing annotation with the same name is removed.
member.param: The annotations to set

member.summary: Retrieves an annotation value for an EDM element. Returns null if no annotation with the given name exists for the given element.
member.param: The annotated element.
Namespace that the annotation belongs to.
Local name of the annotation.
member.returns: Returns the annotation value that corresponds to the provided name. Returns null if no annotation with the given name exists for the given element.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Annotations.IEdmDirectValueAnnotationsManager.GetAnnotationValues(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Data.Edm.Annotations.IEdmDirectValueAnnotationBinding})
member.summary: Retrieves a set of annotation values. For each requested value, returns null if no annotation with the given name exists for the given element.
member.param: The set of requested annotations
member.returns: Returns values that correspond to the provided annotations. A value is null if no annotation with the given name exists for the given element.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ExpressionTypeChecker
member.summary: Collection of extension methods to assert that an expression is of the required type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ExpressionTypeChecker.TryAssertType(Microsoft.Data.Edm.Expressions.IEdmExpression,Microsoft.Data.Edm.IEdmTypeReference,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.EdmError}@)
member.summary: Determines if the type of an expression is compatible with the provided type
member.param: The expression to assert the type of.
The type to assert the expression as.
Errors produced if the expression does not match the specified type.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the expression is valid for the given type or not.
member.remarks: If the expression has an associated type, this function will check that it matches the expected type and stop looking further. If an expression claims a type, it must be validated that the type is valid for the expression. If the expression does not claim a type this method will attempt to check the validity of the expression itself with the asserted type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ExpressionTypeChecker.TryAssertType(Microsoft.Data.Edm.Expressions.IEdmExpression,Microsoft.Data.Edm.IEdmTypeReference,Microsoft.Data.Edm.IEdmType,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.EdmError}@)
member.summary: Determines if the type of an expression is compatible with the provided type
member.param: The expression to assert the type of.
The type to assert the expression as.
The context paths are to be evaluated in.
A value indicating whether the expression must match the asserted type exactly, or simply be compatible.
Errors produced if the expression does not match the specified type.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the expression is valid for the given type or not.
member.remarks: If the expression has an associated type, this function will check that it matches the expected type and stop looking further. If an expression claims a type, it must be validated that the type is valid for the expression. If the expression does not claim a type this method will attempt to check the validity of the expression itself with the asserted type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Library.EdmEntityType.FixUpDefaultPartnerInfo(Microsoft.Data.Edm.Library.EdmNavigationPropertyInfo,Microsoft.Data.Edm.Library.EdmNavigationPropertyInfo)
member.summary: The puspose of this method is to make sure that some of the fields are set to valid partner defaults. For example if .Target is null, it will be set to this entity type. If .TargetMultiplicity is unknown, it will be set to 0..1, etc. Whenever this method applies new values to , it will return a copy of it (thus won't modify the original). If is null, a new info object will be produced.
member.param: Primary navigation property info.
Partner navigation property info. May be null.
member.returns: Partner info.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules
member.summary: Built in Edm validation rules.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.ElementDirectValueAnnotationFullNameMustBeUnique
member.summary: Validates that no direct value annotations share the same name and namespace.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NamedElementNameMustNotBeEmptyOrWhiteSpace
member.summary: Validates that a name is not empty or whitespace.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NamedElementNameIsTooLong
member.summary: Validates that an element name is not too long according to the CSDL spec.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NamedElementNameIsNotAllowed
member.summary: Validates that an element name matches the allowed pattern of names according to the CSDL spec.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.SchemaElementNamespaceMustNotBeEmptyOrWhiteSpace
member.summary: Validates that an element namespace is not empty or whitespace.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.SchemaElementNamespaceIsTooLong
member.summary: Validates that an element namespace is not too long according to the CSDL spec.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.SchemaElementNamespaceIsNotAllowed
member.summary: Validates that an element namespace matches the allowed pattern of namespaces according to the CSDL spec.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.SchemaElementSystemNamespaceEncountered
member.summary: Validates that an element namespace is not a reserved system namespace.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.SchemaElementMustNotHaveKindOfNone
member.summary: A schema element without other errors must not have kind of none.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntityContainerElementMustNotHaveKindOfNone
member.summary: An entity container element without other errors must not have kind of none.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntityContainerDuplicateEntityContainerMemberName
member.summary: Validates that there are no duplicate names in an entity container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntitySetTypeHasNoKeys
member.summary: Validates that there is no entity set whose entity type has no key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntitySetInaccessibleEntityType
member.summary: Validates that the entity type of an entity set can be found from the model being validated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntitySetCanOnlyBeContainedByASingleNavigationProperty
member.summary: Validates that an entity set can only have a single navigation property targetting it that has Contains set to true.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntitySetNavigationMappingMustBeBidirectional
member.summary: Validates that if a navigation property is traversed to another entity set, and then the navigation properties partner is traversed, the destination will be the source entity set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntitySetAssociationSetNameMustBeValid
member.summary: Validates an association set's name is correct

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntitySetNavigationPropertyMappingsMustBeUnique
member.summary: Validates that no navigation property is mapped to two different entity sets.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntitySetRecursiveNavigationPropertyMappingsMustPointBackToSourceEntitySet
member.summary: Validates that if a navigation property mapping is of recursive containment, the mapping points back to the source entity set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntitySetNavigationPropertyMappingMustPointToValidTargetForProperty
member.summary: Validates that the target of a navigation property mapping is valid for the target type of the property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.StructuredTypeInvalidMemberNameMatchesTypeName
member.summary: Validates that a type does not have a property with the same name as that type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.StructuredTypePropertyNameAlreadyDefined
member.summary: Validates that there are not duplicate properties in a type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.StructuredTypeBaseTypeMustBeSameKindAsDerivedKind
member.summary: Validates that the base type of a complex type is complex, and the base type of an entity type is an entity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.StructuredTypeInaccessibleBaseType
member.summary: Validates that the base type of a structured type can be found from the model being validated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.StructuredTypePropertiesDeclaringTypeMustBeCorrect
member.summary: Validates that the declaring type of a property contains that property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.OpenTypesNotSupported
member.summary: Open types are supported only in version 1.2 and after version 2.0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.OnlyEntityTypesCanBeOpen
member.summary: Open types are supported only on entity types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EnumTypeEnumsNotSupportedBeforeV3
member.summary: Raises an error if an enum type is found.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EnumTypeEnumMemberNameAlreadyDefined
member.summary: Validates that there are not duplicate enum members in an enum.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EnumMustHaveIntegerUnderlyingType
member.summary: Raises an error if the underlying type of an enum type is not an integer type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EnumMemberValueMustHaveSameTypeAsUnderlyingType
member.summary: Raises an error if the type of an enum member doesn't match the underlying type of the enum it belongs to.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntityTypeDuplicatePropertyNameSpecifiedInEntityKey
member.summary: Validates that there are not duplicate properties in an entity key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntityTypeInvalidKeyNullablePart
member.summary: Validates that no part of an entity key is nullable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntityTypeEntityKeyMustBeScalar
member.summary: Validates that all parts of an entity key are scalar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntityTypeEntityKeyMustNotBeBinaryBeforeV2
member.summary: Validates that no part of an entity key is a binary primitive type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntityTypeInvalidKeyKeyDefinedInBaseClass
member.summary: Validates that a key is not defined if there is already a key in the base type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntityTypeKeyMissingOnEntityType
member.summary: Validates that the entity type has a key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntityTypeKeyPropertyMustBelongToEntity
member.summary: Validates that all properties in the key of an entity blong to that entity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.EntityReferenceTypeInaccessibleEntityType
member.summary: Validates that the entity type wrapped in this entity reference can be found through the model being validated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.TypeMustNotHaveKindOfNone
member.summary: A type without other errors must not have kind of none.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.PrimitiveTypeMustNotHaveKindOfNone
member.summary: A primtive type without other errors must not have kind of none.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.ComplexTypeInvalidAbstractComplexType
member.summary: Validates that a complex type is not abstract.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.ComplexTypeInvalidPolymorphicComplexType
member.summary: Validates that a complex type does not inherit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.ComplexTypeMustContainProperties
member.summary: Validates that a complex type contains at least one property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.RowTypeBaseTypeMustBeNull
member.summary: Validates that a row type does not have a base type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.RowTypeMustContainProperties
member.summary: Validates that a row type contains at least one property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.StructuralPropertyNullableComplexType
member.summary: Validates that any property with a complex type is not nullable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.StructuralPropertyInvalidPropertyType
member.summary: Validates that the property is of an allowed type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.StructuralPropertyInvalidPropertyTypeConcurrencyMode
member.summary: Validates that if the concurrency mode of a property is fixed, the type is primitive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyInvalidOperationMultipleEndsInAssociation
member.summary: Validates that only one end of an association has an OnDelete operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyCorrectType
member.summary: Validates that the type of a navigation property corresponds to the other end of the association and the multiplicity of the other end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyDuplicateDependentProperty
member.summary: Validates that the dependent properties of a navigation property contain no duplicates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyPrincipalEndMultiplicity
member.summary: Validates multiplicity of the principal end: 0..1 - if some dependent properties are nullable, 1 - if some dependent properties are not nullable. * - not allowed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyDependentEndMultiplicity
member.summary: Validates that if the dependent properties are equivalent to the key of the dependent end, the multiplicity of the dependent end cannot be 1 Validates multiplicity of the dependent end according to the following rules: 0..1, 1 - if dependent properties represent the dependent end key. * - if dependent properties don't represent the dependent end key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyDependentPropertiesMustBelongToDependentEntity
member.summary: Validates that all dependent properties of a navigation property belong to the dependent entity type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyInvalidToPropertyInRelationshipConstraintBeforeV2
member.summary: Validates that all dependent properties are a subset of the dependent entity types key.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyEndWithManyMultiplicityCannotHaveOperationsSpecified
member.summary: Validates that the navigation property does not have both a multiplicity of many and an OnDelete operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyContainsTargetNotSupportedBeforeV3
member.summary: Validates that is not set prior to V3.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyWithRecursiveContainmentTargetMustBeOptional
member.summary: Validates that if a navigation property has = true and the target entity type is the same as the declaring type of the property, then the multiplicity of the target of navigation is 0..1 or Many. This depends on there being a targetting cycle. Because of the rule , we know that either this is always true, or there will be an error

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyWithRecursiveContainmentSourceMustBeFromZeroOrOne
member.summary: Validates that if a navigation property has = true and the target entity type is the same as the declaring type of the property, then the multiplicity of the source of navigation is Zero-Or-One. This depends on there being a targetting cycle. Because of the rule , we know that either this is always true, or there will be an error

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyWithNonRecursiveContainmentSourceMustBeFromOne
member.summary: Validates that if a navigation property has = true and the target entity type is defferent than the declaring type of the property, then the multiplicity of the source of navigation is One.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyEntityMustNotIndirectlyContainItself
member.summary: Validates that if an entity does not directly contain itself, it cannot contain itself through a containment loop.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyTypeMismatchRelationshipConstraint
member.summary: Validates that each pair of properties between the dependent properties and the principal ends key are of the same type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Data.Edm.Validation.ValidationRules.NavigationPropertyAssociationNameIsValid
member.summary: Validates that an association name is valid.
